result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen Daniel Sladky

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen Daniel Sladky in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Stephen Daniel Sladky.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Stephen Daniel Sladky appeared by video.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo appeared by video for Stephen Daniel Sladky.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Stephen Daniel Sladky in court with attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (missed office contact), filed.

Court ordered no contact with KLG, dob 9/28/1970
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Stephen Daniel Sladky in court with attorney Julita Kishma de Leon.  Defendant Stephen Daniel Sladky in custody.  Nate Mcclure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
